verses.english: For fire or wild beasts that overcame them were punishments for them, and for their wicked deeds.

verses.latin: Contra vero, quod illis contigit, nihil contra, quia ipsi sunt, qui omnia, id est, quid ad illos facta sunt.
verses.english: On the contrary, nothing happened against them. They themselves are the ones who have done everything.

verses.latin: Nam justis, non tantum illis, sed etiam et istis, datam est nox, et cognoscentes illa, quibus passi sunt, ipsi, et non timentes, ad mortem.
verses.english: For to the just, not only to them, but also to these others, was given night, and they knowing those things which they have suffered, themselves feared not even death.

verses.latin: Filius autem illorum, qui fuerunt, pervenit in brevi; et videntes viderunt, et cognoscentes, cognoverunt, quid passa est justitia.
verses.english: And the son of those who were, came quickly. And, seeing, they saw, and knowing, they knew what justice has suffered.

verses.latin: Postea autem, cum iniusti mortui essent, flagellum et plaga eis, ad horrorem, et justis, ad gloriam.
verses.english: Afterwards, when the unjust had died, there was a scourge and a plague to them, and for the righteous, glory.

verses.latin: Nam in brevi, operati sunt illos, et morientes, viderunt opera eorum, et cognoverunt, quibus passi sunt.
verses.english: For in a short time they were tormented, and dying, they saw their works and knew what they had suffered.

verses.latin: Et, sicut illi, perierunt, et justis, ad gloriam; sed pro illis, in brevi, qui facti sunt, sicut et illi, cum illis, ad damnationem.
verses.english: And as they perished, the just had glory. But for them, in short, who were made as they were, with them, to condemnation.

verses.latin: Itaque viderunt, et hoc, et illud, et ad tempus illud, et cum ipsi in agone erant, et videntes, audierunt, quid est.
verses.english: And therefore they saw both this, and that, and for that time, and when they were in conflict, they saw, and they heard what it is.

verses.latin: Nam per quem, ante, jactati sunt, et ipsi, et non ignoraverunt, quibus illi fuerunt, et quibus pro ipsis, et quibus ad mortem.
verses.english: For they were once cast down, and they did not ignore who they were, and who were for them, and who were for death.

verses.latin: Nam, quod tunc errantes, et videntes, non crediderunt, nunc, cum passi sunt, et cognoscentes, in pœnitentiam, pro ipsis.
verses.english: For, that which they had once wandered, and seeing, they did not believe, now, when they suffered, and knowing, they repented for themselves.

verses.latin: Et, ut per quam, per illos, quae judicabantur, ea, cum perirent, et non moriebantur.
verses.english: And, that through which they were judged, those things, when they perished, did not die.

verses.latin: Nam, quam, cum justi, in agone erant, eorum, omnia, viderunt; et postea, in pœnitentia, viderunt; et non sunt mortui.
verses.english: For, when the just were in conflict, they saw all things, and afterwards, in repentance, they saw; and they did not die.

verses.latin: Sed, sicut et illi, et illi, in illis, perierunt.
verses.english: But, as they perished, so did they perish in them.

verses.latin: Sed et insensati naturae, et nesciverunt Deum, neque per bona, quae videntur, potuerunt invenire eum, nec operibus agnoscerunt artificem.
verses.english: But those who are spiritually dead don’t know God, and they can’t find Him by looking at good things, and they don’t recognize the craftsman by his work.

verses.latin: Sed aut ignem, aut ventum, aut citatum aerem, aut gyrum stellarum, aut aquam impetuosam, aut solem et lunam, rectores mundi, deos putaverunt.
verses.english: Instead, they think that fire, or wind, or fast-moving air, or the stars’ motion, or rushing water, or the sun and moon, which govern the world, are gods.

verses.latin: Quorum speciem si delectati putaverunt deos, sciant quod multo meliores sunt illi, quam ista: quia illorum creator, species enim creavit illos.
verses.english: If they were charmed by their appearance, they should know that these things are much better than they seem: the creator of them made these very things.

verses.latin: Si autem virtutem illorum, et opera mirata sunt, intelligant ex illis, quod qui fecit illa, fortior est illis:
verses.english: If they were amazed by their strength and by how they work, let them understand from these things that whoever made them is stronger than they are:

verses.latin: a magnitudine enim speciei, et creaturae, cognoscibiliter potuerunt de auctore suspicari, quoniam et virtus illius per haec cognoscitur.
verses.english: because by how great and well-made the creation is, they can understand the creator. So, too, His power is known through these things.

verses.latin: Verumtamen nec ipsis his excusatio est: si enim tantum potuerunt scire, ut investigarent saeculum: quomodo has citius non invenerunt dominum ejus?
verses.english: But still, they have no excuse: if they were able to know so much that they could investigate the world, why did they not find the Lord more quickly?

verses.latin: Sed vae illis, et quae sunt illorum: quoniam ipsi mortuos, pro diis putaverunt, et idola, et aurum, et argentum, artificium hominum, et similitudinem bestiarum, aut lapidem inutilem, opere manuum antiquum.
verses.english: But woe to them, and to their works: because they thought that the dead were gods, and also idols, and gold, and silver—man-made objects, and images of animals, or a useless stone from the hands of someone long ago.

verses.latin: Quare si delectati sunt operibus illorum, pro diis putaverunt ea: et nunc quid se excusaturi sunt, quod in illis speraverunt?
verses.english: Therefore, if they were pleased with what they made, they thought these things were gods: and what excuse will they give now, because they put their hope in these things?

verses.latin: Si enim et in vita, et in morte, super illos habuerunt, et in die, qua judicantur, erit illis poena.
verses.english: For they have power over them in both life and death, and they will be punished on the day when they are judged.

verses.latin: Miseros enim, et sancta illius odientibus, et impiis, et quae ipsius sunt, odientibus, et bona, et iis qui oderunt vitam, et male agentibus.
verses.english: They are miserable, and they hate His holy ones, and they hate the impious, and they hate His things, and the good, and those who hate life, and those who do evil.

verses.latin: Quorum et opera mala sunt, et vita eorum mala: et putant, quoniam non Deus est cum illis: sed et ipsi iniqua committentes, aut per consilia injusta perversi sunt.
verses.english: Their works are evil, and their lives are evil: and they think that God is not with them: and they commit iniquity, and they are perverted by their unjust plans.

verses.latin: Est enim alia mali vis, et aliud mendacium, et aliud vita, quam illi existimant, et illis qui facta sunt, mala causa est, ut peccatum illorum, aut per ignem, aut per aquam persequatur illos.
verses.english: There is a different power of evil, and a different lie, and a different life than they think, and for those who made these things, there is an evil cause, so that their sin will follow them through fire, or through water.

verses.latin: Quoniam quod in Deum faciunt, et peccata eorum, eadem, sicut ipsi, in ira illos persequuntur.
verses.english: Because what they do to God, and their sins, pursue them in anger, as they themselves are.

verses.latin: Hoc est enim, quod illi putaverunt: quoniam si bene fecerint, regnabunt, et qui erunt, et gloriosi. Propter hoc et ad seipsos perniciosa sunt.
verses.english: This is what they think: that if they do well, they will reign, and they will exist, and be glorious. For this reason they are also destructive to themselves.

verses.latin: Propter hoc ergo irati sunt justis, et pro peccato eorum occiderunt eos, qui in vita sancti erant, et justi. Quorum sanguis nunc vindicatur.
verses.english: Therefore they were angry at the just, and for their sin they killed those who were holy and just in life. Their blood is now avenged.

verses.latin: Isti autem irati sunt, qui nihil valebant, et qui nihil cognoverunt, irati sunt iis, qui erant meliores illis.
verses.english: But they, being angry, were worth nothing, and they knew nothing, being angry at those who were better than them.

verses.latin: Propter hoc mortui sunt, et putaverunt vitam esse illis, et morientes, contristati sunt: quoniam et ipsi, qui mortui sunt, injusti fuerunt, et iniqua judicaverunt.
verses.english: For this reason they died, and they thought that life was for them, and they were saddened when they died: because even they who died were unjust, and they judged iniquity.

verses.latin: Et quoniam quoniam non semper dissimulavit Deus, et potentia illius, et illa non dissimulavit. Quoniam hic homo qui sine Deo, occidit justum, et justum, et impium, aeque peribunt.
verses.english: And since God did not always dissimulate, His power did not dissimulate either. Because this man, who is without God, killed the just, and the just and the impious will perish alike.

verses.latin: Quoniam nunc opera impiorum, quasi ventus, et quasi navis in aquis sine gubernaculo, quam transit, et post eam ignoratur via. Et quasi avis per aerem volans, nullius vestigium itineris invenitur, quasi sagitta in signum percussa.
verses.english: For now the works of the impious are like the wind, and like a ship on water without a rudder, which passes, and the path is unknown after it. And like a bird flying through the air, no trace of the journey is found, and like an arrow shot at a target.

verses.latin: Et quasi sagitta percussa per aerem, et statim dividitur aer, et non cognoscitur transitus ejus. Sic et nos per breve tempus nati, et statim evanemur: et non poterimus ostendere vestigium boni operis: sed in malitia consumemur.
verses.english: And like an arrow striking through the air, and the air is immediately divided, and its passing is not known. So also we are born for a short time, and immediately we vanish: and we will not be able to show the trace of a good work: but we will be consumed in malice.

verses.latin: Memorans enim testamentum suum, Dominus misit liberatores de gentibus.
verses.english: Remembering His covenant, the Lord sent redeemers to rescue them from the pagan nations.

verses.latin: Virum sanctum Moysen, et Aaron fratrem ejus: et dedit in populo suo sanctitatem.
verses.english: He sent holy men: Moses and his brother Aaron. Through them, He gave His people a sense of holiness.

verses.latin: Dedit illis testamentum in sanctificationem, et legem vitae.
verses.english: He gave them His testament so they would be sanctified, and the Law so they could have life.

verses.latin: Et ostendit illis justitias judiciorum suorum, et opera manuum suarum.
verses.english: He revealed His just judgements, and the works that His hands had made.

verses.latin: Memorans testamenti sui, ostendit mirabilia operum suorum.
verses.english: Remembering the covenant, He displayed the wonders of His works.

verses.latin: Et glorificavit eos in sanctificatione, et conservavit eos in justitia.
verses.english: He glorified them in holiness and kept them in righteousness.

verses.latin: Exaudivit illos in precibus suis, et de loco sancto suo.
verses.english: He heard their prayers from His holy place.

verses.latin: Propitius erat in diebus tribulationis eorum, et eruit eos.
verses.english: He was merciful to them in their days of tribulation and rescued them.

verses.latin: Et percusserat Aegyptios plagas, magnas et terribiles.
verses.english: He struck the Egyptians with plagues that were great and terrifying.

verses.latin: Ostendit virtutem manuum suarum.
verses.english: He showed the power of His hands.

verses.latin: Dedit plagam magnam, ut ostenderet iniquitatem, et exstirpavit hostes.
verses.english: He gave them a great plague to reveal their wickedness, and He destroyed their enemies.

verses.latin: Et dedit sanctos suos in justitia, et legem sine dolo.
verses.english: He gave His holy ones righteousness and a law without deceit.

verses.latin: Memoratus est testamenti sui, et in justitia operum suorum.
verses.english: He remembered His covenant and the righteousness of His works.

verses.latin: Dedit illis haereditatem gentium, et opera manuum justorum.
verses.english: He gave them the inheritance of the nations, and the works of the just.

verses.latin: Et partitio manuum Domini, et opera justorum.
verses.english: Both the work of the Lord's hands, and the works of the just, are His.

verses.latin: Inimicos eorum contrivit, et tribuit illis hereditatem fortium.
verses.english: He broke the power of their enemies, and gave them the inheritance of the strong.

verses.latin: Ut glorificarent sanctum nomen ejus, et offerrent Deo laudes in voce sua.
verses.english: So that they would glorify His holy name and offer God their praises.

verses.latin: Et exstirpavit gentem impiorum ante faciem eorum.
verses.english: He rooted out the impious peoples before them.

verses.latin: Ut cum justitia opera ejus laudarent, et glorificarent mirabilia ejus.
verses.english: So they would praise His works with justice, and glorify His wonders.

verses.latin: Et laudabunt eum cum gloria potentiae ejus, et narrabunt magnitudinem operum ejus.
verses.english: And they will praise Him with the glory of His power, and they will proclaim the greatness of His works.

verses.latin: Hic est enim finis eorum, qui cum justitia fecerunt, ut esset cum illis.
verses.english: This is the end for those who have acted justly, so they may be with Him.

verses.latin: Et cum operibus suis, in gloriam sanctorum.
verses.english: And with their works, they enter the glory of the saints.

verses.latin: Memoriam tuam, Domine, posuerunt in eo qui est contra ius,
verses.english: The nations who opposed Your commandments, Lord, have done the opposite of what is right.

verses.latin: et cognoverunt filii tui quoniam impii perierunt,
verses.english: Your children knew that the wicked are lost,

verses.latin: et in propatulo inimicorum eorum perierunt.
verses.english: and the wicked perished in the open for all of their enemies to see.

verses.latin: Viderunt enim simulacra eorum gentiles,
verses.english: The Gentiles saw the idols,

verses.latin: quae non sunt, et judicaverunt deos esse
verses.english: which do not even exist, and they thought the idols were gods.

verses.latin: simulacri mortui, et judicium iustorum.
verses.english: Therefore, the Gentiles will be judged by the true judge, as will the dead idols.

verses.latin: Unde et tunc, veniens ultio, visitans eos invenit eos dignos.
verses.english: So when the time came for punishment, the Lord visited them and found them worthy of their punishment.

verses.latin: Nam et in operibus suis impiis
verses.english: For the Gentiles were using wicked deeds,

verses.latin: in quibus desipiebant,
verses.english: to do even more foolish things,

verses.latin: quoniam irrationabiles fuerunt.
verses.english: because the Gentiles lacked rational thought.

verses.latin: Nam et filios suos, et filias suas sacrificantes daemoniis,
verses.english: They sacrificed their own children to demons,

verses.latin: et ad ea quae non erant,
verses.english: and they offered these children to those who do not exist, to idols.

verses.latin: morte occiderunt infantes,
verses.english: They murdered their own children,

verses.latin: et eorum quae erant sacrificia,
verses.english: and they would murder those who were sacrifices,

verses.latin: venena quae iniqua erant, perierunt.
verses.english: using poison that was wicked, and they were destroyed.

verses.latin: Et nullum dolus latere potuit.
verses.english: And because of this, the deception that was created by them could no longer remain hidden.

verses.latin: Nam et illi, velut in somnis, errantes
verses.english: For those wicked people, who were like people wandering around in a dream,

verses.latin: velut avolantes somnium apprehenderunt.
verses.english: imagined they were actually flying when dreaming.

verses.latin: Et illi quidem, in hoc in quo confidebant, moriebantur.
verses.english: The Gentiles died because of these delusions, which they trusted in.

verses.latin: Nam et ea quae non erant, quasi deos putabant esse.
verses.english: For they thought things that did not exist were gods.

verses.latin: Et ea quae faciebant cum furore, aut jurantes iniuste,
verses.english: They swore false oaths, and did evil things with great anger,

verses.latin: adhibentes iniquitatem, dignum erat ut perirent.
verses.english: and because of this, they deserved to be destroyed.

verses.latin: Non enim illa per quae jurabant, virtus erat, sed per peccatum
verses.english: The false gods they swore by did not have any power, instead, the sin itself deserved punishment.

verses.latin: justitiam iurantes, ipsi per illud iuramentum perierunt.
verses.english: They would swear oaths that contained injustice, and would be destroyed by these oaths.
